body:
Spack failed to patch openblas 0.2.15. The same error messages arise when I tried to patch it manually.

This patch is generated by git. I am not sure if incompatability between `diff` and `git diff` lead to this issue. Similar issue happen to OpenMPI 2.0.1. In #2962  , I replaced the original git-generated patch file with one generated locally with `diff`.

```

/home/rpm/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:1020, in do_patch:

     980          if not self.patches and not has_patch_fun:
     981              tty.msg("No patches needed for %s" % self.name)
     982              return
     983
     984          # Construct paths to special files in the archive dir used to
     985          # keep track of whether patches were successfully applied.
     986          archive_dir = self.stage.source_path
     987          good_file = join_path(archive_dir, '.spack_patched')

     1002             return
     1003         elif os.path.isfile(no_patches_file):
     1004             tty.msg("No patches needed for %s" % self.name)
     1005             return
     1006
     1007         # Apply all the patches for specs that match this one
     1008         patched = False
     1009         for spec, patch_list in self.patches.items():

     1011                 for patch in patch_list:
```

```
$ tar xzvpf /tmp/rpm/spack_source_cache/openblas/openblas-0.2.15.tar.gz
$ cd OpenBLAS-0.2.15
$ patch -s -p 1 -i /home/rpm/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openblas/make.patch
1 out of 1 hunk FAILED -- saving rejects to file Makefile.system.rej
1 out of 2 hunks FAILED -- saving rejects to file getarch.c.rej
```

```
$ head -2 /home/rpm/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openblas/make.patch
diff --git a/Makefile.system b/Makefile.system
index b89f60e..2dbdad0 100644
```
title: openblas: segmentation fault with Intel 16.0.3
